title: Save and restore custom connection panel layout
author: fwetzler98
body_snippet:
Hello mRemoteNG-Team,

Having last stable Release 1.75 installed.

One connection is open in "General" Panel
Rightclick on connection in connection tree: -> connect with options -> choose panel before connecting. New Panel "PanelA", OK, OK. --> New connection is shown in just created "PanelA" right to the "General" Panel. Moving "PanelA" and drop on "Bottom Icon"
--> Visible now: two open connections, each in own Panel, "General" Panel on top half of window, "PanelA" on bottom half of wind...

comments.snippet: We haven't ever saved that sort of information before, so this would be a new feature. This would be a good enhancement
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet:
This would be a fantastic improvement.  Saved panel profiles would be most ideal, and even better if a "default panel layout" could then be added as a variable in connection db files; doing so would extend this feature further across the daily UX. 

Really, even just a partial enhancement that could save the current layout on exit, for use on next launch, would be a huge timesaver. Going back and forth between a large 1440p screen and then to an aging laptop throughout the day makes for much r...
comments.author: mjmooney

comments.snippet:
Totally agree. This would be a huge improvement to mRemoteNG.
Every day I have to manually open a 2nd panel, and then arrange both panels manually ...
If this could be done automaticaly would be excellent. 
Also, on the "Create an empty panel when mRemoteNG starts" if we could open more the 1 would also be great.
comments.author: ptmarco

comments.snippet: This would be a great enhancement if implemented together with #2051

comments.snippet: in new release panel positions will be saved so on next load that will be restored, or in next release when profiles will be implemented you may chose what profile to load (adding small logic to what user if you wish, to load separate profiles) and base on that such settings will be loaded
